meanings.definition: Deserving of respect or high regard.
meanings.sent1: She received an honorable award for her hard work.
meanings.sent2: The judge made an honorable decision based on the evidence.
meanings.sent3: It was an honorable gesture when he helped the lost puppy find its way home.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to charity work is truly honorable.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's bravery was nothing short of honorable.

meanings.sent1: He is known for his honorable conduct in all situations.
meanings.sent2: The company's policy is to always act in an honorable manner.
meanings.sent3: Even in a game, he played honorably and never cheated.
meanings.sent4: The honorable way he handled the disagreement impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: Her commitment to honesty and fairness is truly honorable.

meanings.sent1: Being a loyal friend is an honorable trait.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's bravery in battle was truly honorable.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at cooking dinner was an honorable effort, even if it didn't turn out well.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style is truly honorable in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dedication to her students is truly honorable.
